content:

title: Mizoram Governor Graces the 2nd Aizawl International Half Marathon
content:
514/2025-2026

Aizawl, the 14th February, 2026:The second edition of the Aizawl International Half Marathon (AIHM), jointly organised by the Department of Sports & Youth Services, Government of Mizoram, and Innovations India under the theme "Connecting India, Developing Mizoram, Empowering Sports", took place today. Mizoram Governor General (Dr) Vijay Kumar Singh (Retd) actively participated by flagging off the runners and presenting awards as the chief guest at Rajiv Gandhi Stadium, Mualpui, Aizawl.

Expressing his delight at the successful hosting of the second edition, the Governor General (Dr) Vijay Kumar Singh commended the participation of runners from various parts of India as well as international athletes from different countries. He highlighted that this strong turnout clearly demonstrates the event's growing international stature and Mizoram's rising recognition on the global sporting stage. He described the Aizawl International Half Marathon as an excellent platform to showcase Mizoram's natural beauty, pristine environment, and excellent air quality.

The Governor emphasised that visitors from outside the state are not merely athletes but welcomed guests, encouraging them to enjoy their stay in Mizoram and return in future years—not just to compete, but also to explore the state's rich culture, heritage, and offerings alongside friends, family, and fellow runners. Viewing the marathon beyond a one-day sporting event, the Governor expressed hope that it would foster a broader commitment to fitness and healthy living among Mizoram's youth. He aspired for it to inspire the adoption of a culture of health and fitness across Mizoram and the entire country. He praised the efforts of the Sports Minister, the Department of Sports & Youth Services, and Innovations India, expressing confidence that AIHM would soon gain recognition and prestige as a globally acclaimed marathon event.

Sports & Youth Services Minister Pu Lalnghinglova Hmar also addressed the gathering, congratulating all participants and noting that the Aizawl International Half Marathon continues to grow bigger and stronger with each edition. He affirmed the organisers' commitment to making future editions even more grand and impactful.

The event was also attended by Environment, Forest & Climate Change Minister Pu Lalthansanga, Health Minister Pi Lalrinpuii, Lt. Col. Clement Lalhmingthanga, MLA, Capt. Rahul Bali (CEO, Innovations India & Curator of AIHM 2026), and other dignitaries.

Nearly 3,000 athletes took part, with the race flagged off by the Governor at 6:30 AM from Rajiv Gandhi Stadium. The course started and finished at the stadium, passing through World Bank Road. The event featured nine categories: 21.1 km Half Marathon (Men & Women), 10 km Open Race (Men & Women), 5 km Fun Race (Men & Women), 5 km Junior Race (Boys & Girls), and 5 km Senior/Veteran Race (above 60 years). Besides participants from different parts of India, 16 international runners from Kenya, Ethiopia, Bahrain, the United Kingdom, and France also took part in the event. A total prize pool of over Rs 15 lakh was distributed.

Larsap General (Dr) Vijay Kumar Singh (Retd) chuan hlawhtling taka Aizawl International Half Marathon tum hnihna buatsaih a ni chu lawmawm a tih thu sawiin, India ram hmun hrang hrang bakah ram dang atanga rawn tel engemawzat an awm chu fakawm tiin, hei hian AIHM chu khawvel huap a nih zia a lantir a, a than chak zia leh khawvel ang pawha hriat a hlawh zia a lantir a ni, a ti a. AIHM chu Mizoram mawina leh boruak thianghlim phochhuahna hun remchang a nih thu sawiin, hmun dang atanga lokalte chu khualtha an nih tel thu a sawi a. Mizoram an cham chhunga hun hlimawm tak hmang tura duhsakna hlanin, nakum lamah pawh thiante, chhungte leh infiammi dangte nen marathon tlan tur chauh ni lo, Mizoram belchiang tura lokal leh ngei turin a sawm a ni.

title: Mizoram CHIEF SECRETARY VISITS MUMBAI
content:
513/2025-2026

Dated Aizawl, the 13 February 2026 :Pu Khilli Ram Meena, Chief Secretary, Mizoram visited office of Maharashtra Chief Secretary Pu Rajesh Aggarwal in Mumbai yesterday and discussed the issues to early facilitate construction of the new Mizoram House in Navi Mumbai (Vashi).

As published by the Government of Mizoram, the City and Industrial Development Corporation (CIDCO) has allotted a plot of land measuring 1983.48 SQM in Vashi, Navi Mumbai in 2008 for construction of a State Guest House cum Emporium for Mizoram. However, work could not be started having some issues with construction agency as well as CIDCO. Now CIDCO is requested to allow extension of time to start the construction of Mizoram House waiving the delay.

The Chief Secretary requested Maharastra Chief Secretary to allow extension of time by 31.03.2026 and also give concession on fee levied for delaying construction.

Pu Rajesh Aggarwal Chief Secretary spoke over phone to higher officials of City and Industrial Development Corporation (CIDCO) to allow required time extension for the State including waiving of fee.Pu Khilli Ram Meena later visited the plot site  at Vashi. Pu H. Lalruatliana, Dy. Resident Commissioner, Mumbai Mizoram House was the supporting officer to CS in his meeting.

title: Ram dang atanga IAS Mizorama posting neite thawhhopui thiam a pawimawh - Dr Vanlalthlana
content:
4471/2025-2026

Aizawl, 14th February, 2026 :Nizan khan Higher & Technical Education minister Dr. Vanlalthlana chuan MS Academy, Aizawl hnuaia zirlai MPSC Combined Exam, 2025-a hlawhtlinna chang mi 14 te lawmpuina hun chu khuallian niin a hmanpui.

He hunah hian khuallian Dr. Vanlalthlana chuan thu sawiin, hlawhtlinna changtute hnenah ram dang atanga IAS Mizoram a posting neite kawm ngeih tur leh thawhhona tha neih pui turin a chah a, an let leh thleng a mi tangkai thei an nih avangin a pawimawh thu a sawi. Sorkar hnathawk ni satliah lo a, sorkar fawng vuantute hnenah rawtna an neih ang te meeting-na pawh a sawi chhuak ngam ve tur leh uluk taka an lo ngaihthlak tur thu a sawi. Minister chuan- thawkrim leh thiam ngah te chu duhsak pawh an hlawh lo thei lo a, chutih laiin mahni invawng zahawm turin hlawhtlinna chang thar te chu a chah. Khawtlang leh Kohhran atangin sum khawn pawh lo awm se mahni income dik tak mila pek mai a that thu a sawi. Sorkar hnathawk tir tan a rang lam a sum peipun lam (Investment) ngaihsak nghal turin a chah bawk a, chhungte tan zan khat mitchhin tawh pawhin mangang a an awm loh nan a that thu a sawi a. Zoramin bung thar kan kai chho mek a, sorkar fawng vuantute hian thil kan hre famkim vek lo a, hmasawnna hi official ram hmangaihtu tak tak te vang a ni a ti. Kan thawhho thiam a ngai a, kan hlawhtlin tirh a Pathian hming kan lam zin ang hian kan hnathawhna dawhkanah Pathian kan mamawhna a la in tan dawn chauh tiin a sawi.

Khualzahawm MYC Chairman, Pu Malsawmzuala Ralte chuan vanram kaina dal tu chu hlawk viau dawnin lang mahse chatuan nun a tan a hlawk dawn loh avanga hnawl ngam turin a chah a. Sorkar hna hian mawhphurhna lian pui a keng tel a, he hna in thawhna chhan tur ber chu mipuite rawngbawl a ni. Chuvangin tumah kan rawngbawlsak a te biak hreawm in kan awm tur a ni lo a ti a, Khawi block-ah emaw BDO niin, a then chu DC office-ah. Staff te leh sumah pawh thuneihna sang tak in nei ngei dawn. Dikna leh midangte chunga that chhuah hi vawn reng tur a ni. Tling tura theihtawp in chhuah ang chiah khan, officer tha leh rintlak ni turin theihtawp in chhuah zui zel dawn nia. A tul huna rang taka decision siam te, sorkar kalphung pela chunglam atanga nawrna te pawh in la tawng ang. Dikna tungding tura huaisen tlat turin ka fuih che u a ni a ti.

MPSC Combined Exam-a hlawhtling mi 14 te pual hian  Mama’s Heaven Vaivakawnah hun hman a ni a. He hun hi hlawhtlinna chang leh an chhungte bakah sawm bik te’n an hmang a ni.

Bawrhsap Pu Donny Lalruatsanga chuan Lawngtlai District chunga Police Department, Excise Department, CYLA leh NGOs dangte thlawpna leh thawhpuina ah lawmthu a sawi a, theihtawpa tha thlah lo a tan la zel turin a ngen nghal bawk. Bawrhsap chuan kalkhawmte hnenah lawmthu sawiin meeting a khar a ni.

title: Hnahthial District Rawpui-ah Jal Arpan Diwas hun hmang, JJM Scheme hmalaknaa tui lakna PHED in an siamsak chu Rawpui WATSAN Committee kutah hlan nghal a ni
content:
4466/2025-2026

Dated Hnahthial, the 13th February, 2026 :Nimin zing dar 7:30 khan Hnahthial District Rawpui-ah Jal Arpan Diwas hun hman a ni a, Rawpui khuain tui hnianghnar an neih theihna lawmna hun leh JJM Scheme hmalakna tui lakna PHED in an siam sak inhlan chhawnna hun hman a ni. He hun hi Hnahthial WATSAN Sub Divisional Officer (SDO) Er. Lalhmangaihzuala chuan a hmanpui a ni.

He hun hi Pu C. Lallawmzuala Sectional Officer Hnahthial Section chuan a kaihruai a, thu sawiin Er. Lalhmangaihzuala, SDO Hnahthial WATSAN Sub-Division, PHED chuan programme hman anih chhan a sawi a. Sorkar laipuiin India ram thingtlangah tui kan nei tha lo em em tih hria in, thingtlang mi tan in tinah tui herhhaw thei nise tiin Aug 15th 2009 khan JJM Scheme a din a, chumi kaltlang chuan he khuaah in tinah mipui ten kum 2009 atang khan tui connection an lo nei ta a. He scheme siam anih chhan chu mipuiten neitu thinlung an neih a, hlut nachang an hriat theih nan a tih in ruahmanna siam a nih thu leh vawiin hi official taka tui a rawn luhna ni tih a sawi bawk a ni.

Scheme hrang hrang siam a ni ṭhin a, sorkar thil chu sorkar ta tih a ni thin a, amaherawhchu JJM scheme-ah erawh chuan mipuite tana hamthatna leh hmasawnna a nih thu a sawi a. PHE department in tui an buaipui chu renchem taka hmang tur leh Pathian thil thlawn pek liau liau a ni tih hria a Tui hi pawisa anga ren thiam turin a chah bawk a ni.

Jal Arpan Diwas-ah hian Er. Lalhmangaihzuala, SDO Hnahthial WATSAN Sub Division chuan Rawpui WATSAN Committee hnenah a hlan a, Pi Hmingchungnungi FTK trained person FTK in hrilhfiahna leh a hman dan a sawifiah bakah hian Rawpui VCP Pu R. Kawlzidinga kaihhruaina hnuaiah thutiam sawirualna neih a ni.
